comments.body: I think it is a good idea, but please do propose that we also get a bigger desert temple. I think the current one is to small to have your idea. Perhaps you could also get some screenshots in here? (I voted)
I agree completely they are way too easy.
I also think that husks should spawn in Desert temples, but no spawners.  The temples should also be slightly larger.
I totally agree with this and just implementing the mechanic like that of pillaher outposts and the pillagers

Maybe they could spawn in those 1x2 tunnel crypt looking rooms?

a 10% chance of a husk spawning in one, and a 15% chance of the husk spawning with a sword?
Yes absolutely! This needs to happen!
This is a legendary idea! People vote this up, please!

I completely agree, but we also need to find a good balance between being able to use boats and to be able to use horses, getting horses across a river is quite difficult, so maybe instead of having places where the river suddenly stops, there could be places where the water is very shallow. (Then boats and horses can both get through easily.)
Agreed, this should get more votes.
Minecraft please notice this! It’ll improve the game in so many ways!
It might be a bit hard to make structures for every shape of river, but this is a good start.
I'm still waiting for this change 5 years later lol.
This would improve river generation so much. I especially like the idea of making the rivers have different appearances based on what biome they're in.

No.  They upgraded villages for a reason.  The old villages look plain and boring.  The new ones are better.  Making some of the villages generate the way they did previously would be counterproductive.
I actually agree because the plain ones allow you to fill the gaps with your imagination.
The old villages were pretty terrible. I'm pretty glad they updated them.

I think this is a very good idea. A new generated structure type (old_village) can be added to world generation, and while it may not spawn as frequently as the new villages (perhaps a 10-20% chance of spawning), it would still be present for those who liked the atmosphere of them.

Aside from that, these villages could be filled with Nitwits, who would possess the old villager AI (hence their titles as Nitwits).
Old villages should spawn abandoned and full of spiderwebs.  Only 1 in 100.
Wack
PLEASE MAKE IT HAPPEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
nah it would be weird if old villages were in Minecraft because then what's the point of new villages.
yes this should be a feature for map makers

moim zdaniem stare i nowe wioski są fajne chociaż nowe mają więcej szczegółów stare wioski nie wyglądały najlepiej domy puste skrzynię tylko u kowala a po zatem wszystkie wioski nie zależnie od biomu były identyczne.

nowe wioski są zróżnicowane na każdym biomie wyglądają inaczej lepsi villagerowie   

nowe wioski są lepsze choć stare też lubie pa.
I agree, old minecraft pe village structure bring me old memories about minecraft
Stairs are a structure, moving to proper category (and removing excess formatting).
Try adding a picture.
I so want that!

Please, please, please no.  What is a "bad thing" and why should the game dictate what you should and shouldn't do?  Part of the fun of the game is the freedom to do what you want.

As to a robber mob, I don't particularly like the idea of a mob that steals from you, and you're going to have to give a lot more argument as to why they should be in the game...
No no no.  What are “bad things”?  This sounds like something for a server.  There are not any rules in single player Minecraft.  How would this make Minecraft better?

Im sorry but i do not really agree with this as what are these bad things are? like for example you are suppose to farm and raid blacksmiths but if these "jails" are created they may keep you for How long??? And as it seems i do not want robbers to break and enter my mansions and take my hard earned diamonds!!! I see no need for this update as it would cause chaous so i say no thanks to this update
Prisons are already in woodland mansions and idk about the robbers and stuff
True.
This is to mode related. Nope.
I'm sorry but it's a terrible idea.

Sounds good, but what about traps next to buried treasure, and temples, instead of “bad things” plus, it sounds way to hard for Minecraft to program it without messing something up... Robbers sound good, though
lol i think purple and white/yellow are pretty good. it has black too so theres that. i still dont see why the skulk sensor is not an end creature, tho.
I like this idea!

I had an idea similar to this, but it's an entire room instead.  I'm going to add my post as a comment here instead, since I feel these are similar enough to each other that mine wouldn't warrant its own post.  Here's mine:

This spawns in mineshafts far more uncommonly than your elevators are, with just 0-2 per mineshaft.  There's a few side tunnels that connect to the main room, and possibly a chest somewhere containing chains and probably some loot as well.  The height and width of the room can vary but there's always a 5x5 elevator shaft in the center of the room with chains holding up a platform.  The platform suspended there can vary in how high it is, but sometimes the chain will be broken with the platform at the bottom of the shaft in pieces, or maybe just absent altogether.

Here's the vertical shaft in the center of the room, which extends downwards many blocks.  Mineshaft tunnels connect to the sides, where minecarts could be loaded onto the platform and carried up and down.  A torch spawns above the entrances, which can be horizontally level to each other.
eles poderiam ter a aparencia dos antigos saqueadores que possuiam um tapa olho

I would also think that if you got to the max level of trade with the Pirates they would lead you with a map to something like a Treasure Island where there are Undead pirates that you must fight to secure massive amounts of pirate loot

I would love to see Mojang add pirates and pirate ships to Minecraft.                                                 

pirates: they carry swords and bows. during the day they will attack you, at night they will trade with you for gold and jewels. but trade too much and they will try to kill you for your loot.           

 pirate ship: moves a little slower than a rowboat and carries 3-6 pirate mobs. if you get too close during the day it will try to follow you and the pirates will shoot arrows at you. at night the ship is stationary and you can climb aboard to trade" at your own risk". if you defeat all the pirates you can loot and steal the ship. can be used as a portable base.                                                                                                            (optional)                                                                                                                                                      Redstone pirate ship core: can be removed from pirate ships once the pirates have been defeated. can push up to 150 blocks as long as it's in contact with water so you can create your own custom ship. can be controlled by pressure plates you stand on "left, straight, right". consumes 1 Redstone block per Minecraft day. maybe combine with other ship cores to push larger custom ships.

Sounds epic! It might be more balanced if there was a pigeon brute or something. It depends how rare and difficult it is. I agree that it would be an epic addition to Minecraft, and hope we see it in Minecraft soon!
Definitely needs balancing, I'd probably just go find a nether fortress, but the hanging temple (with easier to find blaze spawners) would be an excellent addition to the game.
Love it! By the way Tau9850, what's a pigeon brute? (Just kidding.)
This would be a great thing to go into the "Minecraft: Foresty Update"
Sound like a very good idea, and I imagine it will look amazing as you described it

Okay, but why add this if it's just another chest? Why not add a "boss bee" or something else, like an abundance of bees?
Good idea! I am really interested in Native American culture, so this gets my vote!

I think something that could be good for this is a statue of a player in the game’s head. This would have to mean that these structures are incredibly rare but cool. Good idea though. But Bedrock needs to get it at the same time as java.

I don't know if you already had this on mind, but making the redstone in the puzzle be selected from presets and mixed and matched with other puzzles to make it a unique experience every time would be awesome. Maybe have the redstone have an obsidian shell around it so that people are forced to go through the puzzles?

This was posted before a lot of this stuff was announced in fact a week after minecon but if I updated it this post would get taken down.

Revision: fallen nether fortresses should be separate structures, spawning very rarely in caves at the bottom of the nether(at a level below lava lakes). When going near, you will get hit by blindness because of an evil force, and you will hear loud, creepy whispering and the occasional quiet scream. Nothing spawns here but mobs called the "tormented souls" which will make the blindness worse and attack you, dealing lots of damage. You can only attack those with a golden sword. They will drop soul essence(I did not think of the crafting recipes yet), but you will have to pick it up very quickly or else it will reform into the mob again. You will get very bad blindness and nausea when you get to the "worst" part of the fortress, where the "swallowed miners" dwell in the ground below you. They will try to pull you into the ground, and you will have to mine to save yourself or find them. Once found, again, you can only fight them with a golden sword, and they deal lots of damage along with a new effect, hallucinations(you will see things that are not there and not see things that are there). These do not respawn, unlike the tormented souls. They have a very rare chance of dropping an ebony pickaxe, which is fast and unbreakable, but also unenchantable and cursed with vanishing. Edit: the fortresses are made out of black nether brick, crafted the same as red nether brick but wither roses instead of nether wart.

I completely agree; Minecraft mostly has big important structures, and then tons of emptiness in-between structures. It would be really cool to just stumble across random oddities that would, like you said, make the world seem more alive.

I'd love to see it too! Currently I installed the Valhelsia Structures mod and I'm absolutely delighted with how much it changes the game. Now, when I'm travelling through plains I can find ruins, houses and small castles besides the normal villages and portals.

I think one of the most important things Minecraft currently lacks is little landmarks in the overworld ground levels. Some biomes, like oceans and deserts, have just the right amount of structures. Others, like plains or forests, are kinda lacking them. Dark forests are great, but you might visit five of those before you find a woodland mansion, and you might travel half your world map before you stumble upon an illager outpost. I think smaller structures like little ruins or abandoned huts and camps would add a lot of personality to those biomes.

I'm sure the minecraft team will do a stunning job if they ever pick this idea. I didn't even think about the upcoming archaeology site structure idea, so no doubt they can blow our minds with their ideas. Hope they adress this "problem" soon :D
You have my full vote.I would love to see more structures that don't have to be big
I think there is already a form of this.  It is called a Jungle Temple.
Piramid in desert

YES!!! Ever since watching Mogswamp play Minecraft Superflat , I have been wanting to play Superflat in Minecraft, so when I got on Minecraft to play, I made a Superflat world, and got dirt. Just dirt and no structures. I would love to have Villages and Strongholds, in Bedrock Superflat.
